result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew G Lutz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of Costs/Surcharges, defendant to serve 10 days jail as an alternate.  Sentence credit for 10 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.
Straight time.  Sentence credit for 20 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew G Lutz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Matthew G Lutz in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Smith makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
20 days jail.  20 days credit.  TIME SERVED.  
COSTS/DNA surcharge: $243.00 / $200.00 = in lieu of costs/surcharges defendant to serve 10 days jail as an alternate, 10 days credit, TIME SERVED. 
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Matthew G Lutz in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
for the 1/5/2016 Hearing for Matthew Lutz @ N80W15174 Hilltop Dr. Menomonee Falls, WI 53051.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Matthew G Lutz in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
